info.title: api.mycia.it
info.description:
This page contains the documentation on how to use MyCia through shared API calls.

 > Note: this spec is based on [jsonapi format v1.1](https://jsonapi.org/format/1.1/) and each request, response and structure SHALL conform to the standard.

## Request Content-Type

The Content-Type for POST and PUT requests can be set to `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` or `multipart/form-data`;

Add an `Accept: application/json` header to the request to get the JSON response.
Sending requests with the `Accept` header is necessary if you want to use URLs
for related endpoints returned by the API, such as pagination URLs.

## Authentication

Some endpoints do not require any authentication, pretty much anything else will require you to be authenticated.

To become authenticated you will need to ask for your API Account.

Once you have your client API account you can pass it in along with your API id as an HTTP header like this:

```
curl -X GET "http://127.0.0.1:3000/v1/module/action" \
-H "Accept: application/json;" \
-H "client_id: your_client_id" \
-H "client_secret: your_client_secret"
```

and this is how POST requests will look:

```
curl -X POST "http://127.0.0.1:3000/v1/module/action" \
-H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded;" \
-H "Accept: application/json;" \
-H "client_id: your_client_id" \
-H "client_secret: your_client_secret" \
-F "field1=data" \
-F "field2=data" \
-F "field3=data"
```

post.summary: Bind a line to a business
Bind a network to a business
Bind a type to a business
Bind a business to a line
Bind a network to a business
Bind a business to a type

items.example: The fieldname must be a valid JSON string.
